:::{#exr-double-exponential}

When does $(a^b)^c = a^{(b^c)}$?

:::

---

:::{#sol-double-exponential}

If $(a^b)^c = a^{(b^c)}$, then since $(a^b)^c = a^{bc}$,
we have:
$$a^{bc} = a^{(b^c)}$$
$$\logf{a^{bc}} = \logf{a^{(b^c)}}$$
$$bc \cdot \logf{a} = b^c\cdot \logf{a}$$
$$bc = b^c$$

This relationship only holds for $b=c=2$.

:::
